intro: Lindsaea longifolia, commonly known as the long-leaved lindsaea, is a species of fern belonging to the family Polypodiaceae. It is characterized by its delicate, linear leaves that are often covered in fine, silky hairs. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as forest floors or rocky crevices. Its reproductive structures, known as sori, are located on the underside of the fronds and produce spores for propagation. Lindsaea longifolia is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, showcasing its adaptability to humid climates.
